title: Side Dish Pairings for Salmon Piccata

items.name: Garlic Broccolini with Lemon Zest
items.details: Trim broccolini ends, blanch in salted boiling water 1-2 minutes, drain and saute in olive oil with minced garlic 2-3 minutes. Finish with salt, pepper, and lemon zest to echo the piccata. Best if your dining partner likes broccoli.

items.name: Honey-Thyme Roasted Carrots
items.details: Slice carrots on a bias or use baby carrots. Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, a drizzle of honey, and a sprinkle of thyme. Roast at 425F for 20-25 minutes until tender and caramelized. Sweet, savory, and pairs well with the lemony briny piccata.

items.name: General pairing principle
items.details: The lemony, caper-driven sauce of piccata pairs best with bright or slightly sweet vegetables. Avoid heavy, rich sides that compete with the sauce.

notes: Salmon piccata is typically served over white rice. Both suggested sides are elegant enough to match the dish. The roasted carrots are a good alternative for anyone who dislikes broccoli.
